articles.title: More elderly Americans are choking to death. Are these devices the answer? - AP News
articles.description: Each year, choking claims the lives of more than 4,100 Americans who are 65 or older. It’s the most vulnerable age group, accounting for about three-quarters of U.S. choking deaths. A number of companies are marketing antichoking devices to the elderly. They …
articles.content:
NEW YORK (AP) It was the scariest choking incident David Palumbo had ever seen.
The 88-year-old man had been dining at a Providence, Rhode Island, Italian restaurant in September 2019. Now he was un… [+6275 chars]
